answers.answer: Herpes symptoms don't show up "almost immediately." This isn't herpes.
This is a case of anxiety!! You do NOT have herpes and all of your tingling is anxiety driven!!

question: I am male and recieved unprotected oral sex 32 days ago.  Almost immediately upon completion of the act my penis was tingly.  The woman i with said it was becaused she smoked.  She later told me she also had bad yeast due to diabetes.  I was concerned so the next day i visited my MD that without testing for anything gave me doxcyclin, z-pack and rosefren shot in the event i did have anything and sent me home.  That may have been a mistake for i then got what felt like a a bad yeast infection.  I went from tingling to itching. He then gave me some fluzacone for yeast that did not help.  3 weeks later i got tested for all STDs and all negative, including herpes, which i know the blood test may not have picked it up that soon.  It is now 32 days later, I still tingle, the tip of the inside of my penis is red and my MD says it is just ureatritus.  I would believe that but after 32 days?  Any ideas?  Late onset herpes?, undiagnosed STD?
title: lingering problems
